metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1000111 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Twisted before 16.3.1 does not attempt to address RFC 3875 section 4.1.18namespace conflicts and therefore does not protect CGI applications fromthe presence of untrusted client data in the HTTP_PROXY environmentvariable, which might allow remote attackers to redirect a CGIapplication's outbound HTTP traffic to an arbitrary proxy server via acrafted Proxy header in an HTTP request, aka an "httpoxy" issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1000111` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-twisted - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.2
python-twisted-bin - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.2
python-twisted-core - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.2
python-twisted-mail - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.2
python-twisted-names - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.2
python-twisted-news - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.2
python-twisted-runner - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.2
python-twisted-web - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.2
python-twisted-words - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.2
python3-twisted - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.2
python-twisted-conch - 1:16.0.0-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: twisted package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '16.0.0-1ubuntu0.2').
twisted package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '16.0.0-1ubuntu0.2').
